Task Result

Task ID: bg_fabef678
Description: Find agent definitions in config
Duration: 1m 3s

---

<analysis>
**Literal Request**: Find where oracle, librarian, and explore agents are defined in oh-my-opencode. Check ~/.config/opencode/ directory, node_modules/bun cache, and look for agent definitions, default models, prompts.

**Actual Need**: User wants to locate the configuration and definition files for these specific agents in the oh-my-opencode OpenCode plugin system.

**Success Looks Like**: Clear file paths with relevant snippets showing agent configurations, models, and where defaults are defined.
</analysis>

<results>
<files>
- /Users/rselbach/.config/opencode/oh-my-opencode.json — Contains custom configurations for explore and librarian agents with their assigned models
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/code-yeongyu/oh-my-opencode/master/assets/oh-my-opencode.schema.json — JSON schema defining all available agents including oracle, librarian, and explore with their configuration properties
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/code-yeongyu/oh-my-opencode/dev/src/index.ts — Plugin main file that loads builtin agents and applies configuration overrides
</files>

<answer>
The oracle, librarian, and explore agents are defined in the oh-my-opencode OpenCode plugin. Here's where to find them:

**Custom Configurations**: Your local config at `/Users/rselbach/.config/opencode/oh-my-opencode.json` defines custom models for explore (opencode/grok-code) and librarian (opencode/gemini-2.5-flash). Oracle is not customized here, so it uses plugin defaults.

**Plugin Schema**: The official schema at `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/code-yeongyu/oh-my-opencode/master/assets/oh-my-opencode.schema.json` defines all agents including oracle, librarian, and explore with their full configuration options (model, temperature, permissions, etc.).

**Plugin Code**: The main plugin file at `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/code-yeongyu/oh-my-opencode/dev/src/index.ts` loads builtin agent definitions and merges them with your custom configs.

Oracle uses GPT-4o by default according to the plugin's README, while your config overrides librarian and explore to use Gemini models.
</answer>

<next_steps>
Check the plugin's GitHub repo for the latest agent definitions and default prompts. If you need to modify oracle's configuration, add it to your local oh-my-opencode.json file following the schema structure.
</next_steps>
</results>

2007:    description: "Sisyphus - Powerful AI orchestrator from OhMyOpenCode. Plans obsessively with todos, assesses search complexity before exploration, delegates strategically to specialized agents. Uses explore for internal code (parallel-friendly), librarian only for external docs, and always delegates UI work to frontend engineer.",

tool_output.preview:
**For specific issue/PR context**:
\`\`\`
gh issue view <number> --repo owner/repo --comments
gh pr view <number> --repo owner/repo --comments
gh api repos/owner/repo/pulls/<number>/files
\`\`\`

---

### TYPE D: COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH
**Trigger**: Complex questions, ambiguous requests, "deep dive into..."

**Execute ALL in parallel (6+ calls)**:
\`\`\`
// Documentation & Web
Tool 1: context7_resolve-library-id \u2192 context7_get-library-docs
Tool 2: websearch_exa_web_search_exa("topic recent updates")

// Code Search

content: Ok, so now please update the oh-my-opencode json file to list all the agents there with their current models, so I can easily overwrite the models if I want to
